hostelries.name: Nell Gwynne Tavern
hostelries.review: Old school proper pub. Tiny. Good in the winter. Nice beer

hostelries.name: The Understudy
hostelries.review: New, concrete, under the NT. Lovely beers. Good atmosphere.

hostelries.name: The Swan at Shakespere's Globe
hostelries.review: Where else would you go for a pint of Meantime after a bit of Will S?

hostelries.name: Ye Olde Mitre
hostelries.review: Local pub if doing trade stuff around Hatton Garden.

hostelries.name: The Duke of Sussex
hostelries.review: Pleasant and polite environs near to Waterloo.

hostelries.name: The Rake
hostelries.review: Like a fabulous cupboard of craft ale delights.

hostelries.name: The George Inn
hostelries.review: Historic, owned by the National Trust.

hostelries.name: The Charles Dickens
hostelries.review: Good selection of beers, bijou heads.

hostelries.name: Rose & Crown
hostelries.review: Pub, beer garden. Within a sniff of Blackfriars Bridge.

hostelries.name: Gordons Wine Bar
hostelries.review: Don't do beer. Rarely get a table. Fabulous

hostelries.name: The Harp
hostelries.review: Why did real ale get so popular?! Always packed. Beer always well kept.

hostelries.name: The White Hart
hostelries.review: Like sitting in your own front room.
